You must hurry, because if the time runs out you’ll have to start the current floor over. Luckily, you can collect hourglasses for some more time, but be careful with the mansion inhabitants, who are everything but friendly.

183204.Name: Crypto
183204.Overview:
It is a coop only game, you will need a second player to play it efficiently.

Your objective is to bring all 4 magical items to their right places at center. They are randomly placed in dungeon and you should search for them and carry them back.

Tricky part is there are monsters and you can't attack while carrying. Also you are slow as snail while carrying and so it is expected that one player should carry and other should defend him.

It is possible to carry same item by both players. In this case you are faster but both can't attack. Also you have to sync your keys to move at that direction.

183205.Name: Convention Quest
183205.Overview:
The Let's Play Gaming Expo in Irving, Texas needs your help! 

Navigate the corridors and hallways of the famous LPGE in your quest to Save the Show!

The vendor hall, the video game museum, the Arkham Arkade, and the chiptune concert stage highlight just some of the parts of the convention you will traverse in your quest to make sure the 2019 show goes off without a hitch.

Choose your character, plan your adventure, and make sure to pay attention to the subtle and not so subtle clues that are presented to you along the way.  it is LPGE's latest piece of merch and it does not get more interactive than playing your way through this year's convention!

The key to the show's success is you.  You alone can save the show.  Are you ready?

183206.Name: Big City Sliding Blaster
183206.Overview: An overhead shooter game for NES inspired by Ballmaster2, with a level editor and 10 stages, and co-op ability. Also supports the SNES mouse on Nintendulator or with a SNES -- NES controller adapter.

183207.Name: Blow 'em Out!
183207.Overview: Blow Em Out is a homebrew NES game developed by Retroscribe, on NintendoAge Forums, who is also known as GreetingCarts on the craft site Etsy. This is his first game in a planned series of holiday themed homebrew games. The idea is to be able to give this game as a gift to a retro gamer for their birthday.

183217.Name: Nesert Golfing
183217.Overview:
NESert Golfing is an NES game heavily inspired by Desert Golfing.

Can be played with the SNES Mouse, if you know how to connect one to an NES. Otherwise the regular controllers work too, and for the party animals who don't like to share a controller 4-player adapters are supported as well. Famicom works too.

For 1 to 4 players.

183218.Name: Proto Dere .Nes
183218.Overview:
This game is not for the faint of heart!

In 'PROTO DERE .NES', you play as a character
trying to escape a burning underground mine.
Use yow athletic prowess to jump over fires and
climb over ladders to reach the exit.
From the ashes of dread, a new life is born.
+ High Quality Graphics
+ Four Channel Sound
+ Unique Characters
+ Endless Fun
Do you have what it takes to survive?
Find out in PROTO DERE .NES!

183224.Name: UXO: Unexploded Ordinance
183224.Overview:
Enter the world of explosions!

In the not-too-distant past, a great war has ended.  As the guns fell silent and the public emerged from their bunkers, the world called for a new hero, a champion that would wipe their lands free of mines.  You are... the -- what? Copyright infringement? Fine. You are... the guy who gets rid of unexploded ordinances! Grab your gear and get to work!

183225.Name: We Are Hejickle
183225.Overview: We Are Hejickle is a homebrew action game, developed by Pubby with music by MovieMovies1. The goal is to progress through the floors by walking onto exits. Killing enemies is optional, but often a necessity as you can't take the stairs when an enemy is adjacent to you. Along the way, you'll collect gems which can be used to purchase items in shops.

183226.Name: Underground Adventure
183226.Overview:
Follow Harry & Jack's adventures in mysterious caves. Collect all the gems to complete the levels. Escape from monsters and complete all levels to reach the final exit! 
 
Underground Adventure is a  classic arcade-ish platform game with gems to collect in a certain amount of time, monsters to avoid (or shoot if you collect the right item) and a 2 player co-op mode.

It  was created for the NESmaker Byte-Off Competition 2019.

183227.Name: Super Uwol
183227.Overview:
Super Uwol is a 2D platformer created for the devkitSMS competition 2016 and it largely retains the concept of the original 2009 Uwol: Quest for Money by the same developers. 

Each room represents a single-screen platform level with coins and enemies. By moving through sides of the screen horizontally the character appears on the other side. When all coins are collected two exits appears and Uwol can choose a new level in the pyramid with some freedom for the path to follow based on the chosen exit.

183229.Name: Teletime
183229.Overview: Homebrew NES cartridge album made by Animal Style (now known as nmlstyl) and NO CARRIER.  This ROM was used to flash the cartridges and is playable on any Nintendo Emulator.

183230.Name: What Remains
183230.Overview: It is 1986. You just came home from a skate session when a video game cartridge falls into your hands. Excited to find out what it contains, you visit your friend who just got a Nintendo for Christmas. You quickly insert the cartridge and a strange list of encrypted files appears... As the story unravels, your life in Sunny Peaks transforms dramatically, and you start uncovering a dark secret threatening everyone. But no despair, your best friend is by your side... as well as a very helpful cat.

AlternateNames.AlternateName: Quest Forge By Order of Kings

183231.Name: Quest Forge: By Order of Kings

183240.Name: Red Pig
183240.Overview: A ROM hack based on the Disney cartoon Talespin. Baloo's airline cargo company, Higher for Hire, makes deliveries all around the world. The air pirates, lead by the daring Don Karnage have increased their attacks against air travel. In order to foil the plans of the pirates, Baloo trades in his normal plane for a "Mini Sea Duck", designed to fly more maneuverability.To get his cargo delivered on time, Baloo must fly over many dangerous areas, and also pick up any cargo stolen or scattered by the air pirates. Eventually, the fortress of the air pirates themselves must be destroyed for air travel to remain safe and profitable. Talespin is a side-scrolling shooter, moving left to right across the screen. The Mini-Seaduck can fire projectiles and switch direction, flying right-to-left while upside-down. The money you make from recovery of these cargo items can be used to purchase upgrades at the end of each level from Wildcat, the mechanic. Many strange boss creatures and devices will guard the final areas of most levels.

183243.Name: RHDE Furniture Fight
183243.Overview:
Here is a homebrew release which offers the similar game-play of Rampart but instead of shooting cannons you are vandalizing your neighbors property.  Build your house out of wall templates, buy furniture, and then break into your opponent's house across the road to steal furniture. Keep your house the better looking of the two to win.
Released in Double Action 53 compilation cart.

183468.Name: Skullanoid
183468.Overview: A Gothic, Halloween themed version of Arkanoid.

183707.Name: Street Fighter II: The World Warrior
183707.Overview:
The game is a simplified version of the original Street Fighter II. The player can choose from 4 characters: Ryu, Chun-Li, Guile and Zangief. There is also Vega (M. Bison in Western territories) as the final boss, although his name is misspelled as "Viga" in this game. They all have their moves (although Zangief's Spinning Piledriver seems to be missing). Like in the original version, the player fights through the other selectable characters (here in a preset order), eventually reaching the final battle with M.Bison/Vega. The player only gets one continue, unlike the official game.

There is no difficulty selection and the game itself has hard AI (but the AI isn't as poorly programmed as the fighting games under Cony Soft's name), and it also has English in some areas, especially in the ending cutscenes.

AlternateNames.AlternateName: Top Gun III: Phantom Air Mission

183775.Name: Top Gun III
183775.Overview: A ROM hack based on the Flight of the Intruder game in this sequel to the sequel you join "Tiger" Cole and "Cool Hands" Grafton as you command the US Naval Aviators over Vietnam. Take on MiGs, AAA, and SAM, and the unforgiving nature of carrier aviation. Configure each plane's loadout for your mission, plan your mission package, then fly your missions. Command multiple sections of planes and switch among them at will. When you're done, you can even try your hand at LANDING on an aircraft carrier.

183909.Name: Tiny Toon 4
183909.Overview: Tiny Toon 4 is a hack of The Bugs Bunny Birthday Blowout for the Famicom. It's Bugs Bunny's 50th birthday and he has been invited to a huge party in his honor. Bug receives a party invitation. It reads, Happy Birthday Bugs! As a member of your fanclub, it is our pleasure to request your presence as the honored guest. At the spectacular Bugs Bunny birthday blowout. However, his fellow Looney Tunes pals are very unhappy about this party.  Nobody has ever given parties in their honor! Why does Bugs Bunny get so much attention, asks Wile E. Coyote. He and the others are so mad that they try to prevent Bugs from reaching his own birthday party. Bugs must now make his way to the party very cautiously, to avoid all those crazy characters.

184154.Name: The Grind
184154.Overview:
Mario’s Right Nut is an interesting homebrew developer as he usually releases a game that is extremely chaotic, but is awesome all in the same breath. The Grind is no different and exactly what the namesake states. You must grind your way through stages in order to complete them. Apparently this game does have an end, however I have not seen it as of yet.

The gameplay is tight and very responsive for what it is. The game almost feels like a Bezerk style shooter with small graphics like Centipede. While the game seemingly goes on forever, there is an end once you reach a certain number of kills.

The graphics are simplistic, yet fit the setting and game play perfectly. I really feel that this game would have benefited by either a multi-player mode and/or some kind of competitive score mode. However,  even as it the game stands, it’s a great little escape that is definitely worth checking out.

184329.Name: Mario in Some Usual Day
184329.Overview: Mario in Some Usual Day is one of those Mario hacks that has the feel of a brand new game or a sequel to SMB 3. The author, JASP, did a fantastic job when creating this game.  Featuring an automatic save feature that saves your progress at the end of each world completed and a brand new Star Coin collection system.  You have to find special Star coins in the levels to be able to access the final world of the game.  New enemies and enemies that you will recognize from other games makes this game feel like it'll be one of those classics that you'll be playing for years to come.

184349.Name: Luigi's Chronicles
184349.Overview: Now that Ghosts have invaded the Mushroom Kingdom and Mario is gone, Luigi in on an adventure to save the Mushroom Kingdom from his greatest fear. He’ll also encounter zombies, Panser plants and the Phantom who makes Luigi’s life miserable. You’ll also find that this hack has two endings, one good and one real. And the music has a sad creepy tone to it. So if your craving for a challenge, help Luigi end this nightmare…

184614.Name: A Winner Is You
184614.Overview:
The first musical cart released by retroUSB, A Winner is You is a collection of your favorite video game tunes played on real instruments.

This is no ordinary musical cart. This cart was created with a special custom board that has a whopping 64MB ROM and allows for full uncompressed PCM audio playback through your console! That means you get actual instrument sounds coming out of your NES!

Even more amazing than full uncompressed audio coming out of your NES is the very talented Sergio Elisondo. Sergio is the sole musician playing and recording each and every instrument you hear in all of the tracks. He is a true one man band.

No modifications to your console are needed in order experience the full quality of these awesome musical recordings!

184620.Name: Chunkout 2
184620.Overview:
Classic tile deleting fun - can you get a Chunkout?

Starting with a random layout of colored tiles, obliterate large chunks of the same color and shape to score big! By strategically removing smaller quantities of tiles you can create bigger and better scores. Maximize your score by deleting all of the tiles!

This sequel to James Todd's 1999 Gameboy Color release brings 3 levels of difficulty into the mix for an even greater challenge. Compete against your family and friends to get your score onto the High Scores list!

185032.Name: 8-Bit Xmas 2017
185032.Overview:
There's nothing more emblematic of the Holiday seasons than the cozy feeling you get waking to a fire and conifer brimming under with presents. That feeling of togetherness and warmth and holiday spirit shared while singing songs of the season with friends and family. That feeling of having all your favorite xmas party games all in one place. Ah, such good times!

This years xmas cart is a multicart that contains all NINE previous years 8 BIT XMAS carts in one! From 2008 to 2016, all 8 BIT XMASes are in their original version, complete with original title scenes, xmas music, and of course the games!!

185034.Name: 8-Bit Xmas 2018
185034.Overview:
There's nothing more emblematic of the Holiday seasons than the cozy feeling you get waking to a fire and conifer brimming under with presents. That feeling of togetherness and warmth and holiday spirit shared while singing songs of the season with friends and family. That feeling of shame as you slide down the hill face first after falling trying to show off. Ah, what great times!

This xmas we are hitting the slopes and doing some skiing, so suit up and grab your gear (snowboarders are welcome too)! Score by making your way through the gates, or hit the ramps and pull off some sick tricks for big points! Be careful not to crash, it will hurt lots and your score will reset!

185054.Name: AO
185054.Overview:
If you like puzzle games and you're up for a challenge, AO is the game for you. The objective is to roll the brick around the game board and drop it through the goal pit.

It sounds easy, right? You'll have to avoid falling off of the edge while maneuvering around tight areas. Do you think you can make it through all the levels before your score reaches zero?

AO features 30 challenging puzzles for 1 or 2 players.

185064.Name: Beat'em & Eat'em
185064.Overview:
Warning! This game is intended for ADULTS ONLY!

The Atari "classic" we all know and love has finally arrived on the NES.

Move two naked women under a building to catch semen a man ejaculates from the top of said building.

Each time you eat 'em as he beats 'em, you score one point. But should you miss, shame on you!

After all, it could've been a famous homebrewer!

This is the first game developed by FG Software, with many more to come! Bon appétit!

185065.Name: Böbl
185065.Overview:
Here's a new game we made for the NES coding competition 2019.

- you're a bubble
- water is your friend, solid tiles kill you
- "rubber ducky jumps" only
   i.e., hold A to dive, then release and let buoyancy handle the rest

This was a one-month project, so don't expect crazy amounts of polish. 😉

185102.Name: Cheman
185102.Overview:
Chemad is mad. The Gods of Metal play a gig tonight and the idea he had of printing out the wanking guitarist GIF so he could get it signed by the band hasn’t come out quite nicely. And if that was not enough, Badajoz’s seventh bio-dance group has organized a batukada festival in the neighbourhood, blocking the entrance to the concert hall.

Help Cheman collecting powwwer medallions while regaining control of the neighbourhood getting rid of all the unnerving batukadas. Don’t let a samba-reggae spoil a good riff!

185103.Name: Cheetahmen: The Creation
185103.Overview:
IN 1996, 1,500 LOST GAME CARTRIDGES WERE DISCOVERED IN A FLORIDA WAREHOUSE……

CHEETAHMEN II BECAME LEGEND AND FORTUNES WERE MADE ON THIS RARE GAME DISCOVERY.

NOW, FROM THAT SAME FLORIDA GAME MAKER:

CHEETAHMEN: THE CREATION
PRAY FOR MERCY

LOCKED AWAY SINCE 1990, THIS UNSEEN, UNPLAYED GAME HAS BEEN WAITING TO BE REDISCOVERED AND JOIN THE RANKS OF ITS INFAMOUS BROTHERS………

185110.Name: 8-BIT XMAS 2017
185110.Overview:
There's nothing more emblematic of the Holiday seasons than the cozy feeling you get waking to a fire and conifer brimming under with presents. That feeling of togetherness and warmth and holiday spirit shared while singing songs of the season with friends and family. That feeling of having all your favorite xmas party games all in one place. Ah, such good times!

This years xmas cart is a multicart that contains all NINE previous years 8 BIT XMAS carts in one! From 2008 to 2016, all 8 BIT XMASes are in their original version, complete with original title scenes, xmas music, and of course the games!!

185123.Name: Cheril Perils Classic
185123.Overview:
The Cheril Perils NES Port we never finished and which ended becoming Yun, the remake! And the port to SEGA 8-bit of the remake of the unfinished port but now finished! Get confused as hell with all the versions of Cheril Perils with this adventure with lots of fun and two gameplay modes!

Cheril arrives to the city and it’s full of zombies! And they won’t let you go until you kill them all! And not only that, you’ll have to clean the Factory and the Forest of Badajoz as well! That forest again! Will you ever be able to escape that forest?

185191.Name: Chicken of the Farm
185191.Overview: Homebrew game built for the 2018 NesDev competition. Features 23 levels and a final boss. Be prepared for the frustration of frog physics and the always-irritating-on-nes birds (amongst other enemies)!

185196.Name: CYO
185196.Overview: Cyo is a simple minimal NES shooting game which is entirely designed and coded by nemesys.

185197.Name: DABG
185197.Overview: Here is a platform game where you gun down enemies and collect money to complete levels. The game also comes with a built in level editor also!

185200.Name: Data East All-Star Collection
185200.Overview:
Enjoy some of the very best games from the Data East library with the All Star Collection cartridge. Published by Retro-Bit® for your NES® consoles, this 5-in-1 cart compiles a must have list of retro classics.

Games Included:

    Bad Dudes
    Buggy Popper
    BurgerTime
    Ring King
    Side Pocket

Included in the Box:

    Data East All Star Collection Cartridge
    Instruction Manual
    Exclusive Button and Sticker Set

185213.Name: Donkey Kong: Pie Factory Edition
185213.Overview: Billy Mitchell would be proud! Finally the NES version of the Donkey Kong arcade game includes all the levels. The Pie Factory completes the game that Nintendo should have released decades ago. Are they pies or cement pans? Nobody knows until you play it

185218.Name: E.T.: The Extra Terrestrial
185218.Overview:
Ouch! E.T. is lost on Earth and wats to get home. Help him build an interplanetary telephone to call for assistance before his energy runs out. But beware of government agents and curious scientists who will sap E.T.'s precious energy before he reaches his goal.

This is a port, made from scratch, by KHAN games.

185227.Name: SOKOBAN
185227.Overview: A very early NES homebrew release, but that doesn't make it less playable. It's Sokoban, it puzzling and addictive....

185228.Name: Hot Seat Harry
185228.Overview: The year is 7250 AD, and the judicial systems of the world have crumbled. Civil and Criminal cases are now settled in an arena-style trial to the death. The Plaintiff and the Defendant are strapped into modified Electric Chairs and forced to use their legs to push the "Hydro-Electric Foot Pedals", which, therefore, in turn, causes an electric current to course through his/her/it's opponent's body. There is no settlement. There is no plea-bargain. Electric Justice for All!!! That's how the story of Strangulation Games' first release goes, a game which sure would've been a killer if it had been released back in the NES games and published by Active Enterprises or Color Dreams. Your objective of the game basically is to hit your joypad A button over and over until it comes loose and drop off. Every time you win the color on the screen changes, very fun indeed!!

185229.Name: GemVenture
185229.Overview: Beta of a game, yet very playable. The game was later released on Cartridge. Here's how the readme file describes the game... GemVenture is puzzle game where you fight against a series of monsters. If you've played PuzzleQuest, you'll feel right at home. You attempt to match colored gems in the playfield, which will give you mana to cast spells, and can heal yourself or hurt your opponent. Your opponent then take a turn matching gems, and you continue back and forth until only one is left standing. GemVenture features 6 character classes, 18 different spells, and 20 monsters, each with their own special characteristics!

185797.Name: Super Royal Pals. 2
185797.Overview:
Super Royal Pals. 2 is a ROM hack of Super Mario Bros. 2. The game replaces the 4 main characters with whole new sprites of Princess Peach, Princess Daisy, Mayor Pauline and Princess Roselina. 

The game does not contain any new levels, however each of the characters have new abilities that they did not have before. 

The lives system has been replaced with a "Death Counter" instead, and 1-UP Mushrooms remove a death from the counter. The slot game has been replaced with collecting 3 coins removes a death from the death counter.

185832.Name: Rockman 7
185832.Overview:
What arthritis-inducing madness is this? A rom hack perhaps? I say thee nay! This is a 100% home-brew remake of the SNES game using NES graphics. But that's not all! The music has been 8-bitted and the sound has been 8-bitted as well. Does this mean we've lost anything?
 
Evidentially not! The graphics are superb and it's all there. Every stage, every item, every nut and bolt ...

Wait, what's that? There's no bolts in the game? And no Rush Search either? In an effort to make these games more NES-like the following things have been changed:

    No intro or midway stages. In addition, all eight stages are available from the start.
    No going back to the level select after beating a stage in Wily's Castle. In addition, if you die all your tanks are gone.
    No bolts. Which means no shopping.
    No Rush Search. I guess that was too NES-like?
    Where the Rush Search adaptor was (in Freezeman's level) the Exit adaptor can be obtained.
    Since there's no Rush Search, you get the PU fist by hitting the ledge where it's hidden in Junkman's level with the Thunder Bolt.
    The Energy Balancer is where Auto's Hyperbolt was in Springman's level.
    Robot Masters don't "flinch" when hit with their weaknesses (meaning they are not pushed back and their attack cycle does not start over).
    Fliptop appears in some levels as his NES incarnation did.
    Beat is NES-ized ... naturally he doesn't work on Wily nor any Robot Master.

These changes are somewhat controversial. After all, the Gameboy games had 4/4 stages and a shop feature, so why not an 8-bit remake of RM7. Even though it's in an attempt to bring RM7 closer to it's NES counterparts, it does mean not *everything* was included in this game.

185943.Name: Super Royal Pals.
185943.Overview:
The evil King Bowser has stolen your people, your treasure and your plumber. Do you have what it takes to fight though eight action-packed worlds to get them back?

Play as the amazing Princess Peach or Daisy in this life-free platformer.

186116.Name: Jay And Silent Bob: Mall Brawl
186116.Overview: Jay and Silent Bob: Mall Brawl is a full 8-bit retro beat-em-up experience with big levels, big bosses, dope combos, and irreverent references to the View Askewniverse. Mall Brawl can be played solo in a 1 player experience where you swap between both Jay and Silent Bob strategically or played with a buddy, in a 2 player co-operative experience, where you fight your way through mallrats, delinquents and security guards to find your way out of the mall and back to the Quickstop.

186138.Genres: Action; Adventure; Life Simulation; Platform; Casino
186138.Name: Action 53: Vol. 4: Actually 54
186138.Overview:
Years in the making, prepare yourself for the ultimate collection of NES titles: 54 of them to be exact, including entries from the NesDev 2017 and 2018 Coding Competitions, a showcase of other stand-out homebrew, and updates to homebrew of yesteryear.

Contributors:

    Adrian Makes Games
        Mega Mountain (with Damian Yerrick, after sylvie)
        Melo-Jellos 2 (with ptoing and SoundSync5000)

        (with M-Tee and Robi)

        Gruniożerca 2: The Great Cavy Rescue!
        (with M-Tee and music from Shiru)
        Gruniożerca 3: The Great Cavy Clean-Up!
        (with M-Tee and Chip Jockey)
    Benjamin Larsson

        (featuring new sound effects and graphics touch-ups just for this volume!)

        LightShields

* Also appears as-is on Vol. 1, re-included to provide an available physical release of the title.
¹ An earlier version appears on Vol. 1
² An earlier version appears on Vol. 2
³ An earlier version appears on Vol. 3

Some entries may have newer versions elsewhere, sometimes even in future volumes of Action 53. This collection retains the same versions provided at the time this volume was released.

186139.Name: Falling
186139.Overview:
Falling is an “endless-faller” where the player dodges obstacles and picks up collectibles while falling through the sky.

GitHub link: https://github.com/tragicmuffin/falling-nes

186164.Name: Electronic Sweet 'N Fun Fortune Teller
186164.Overview: Electronic Sweet-N-Fun Fortune Teller is an original love horoscope game programmed for play on the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES). The game is 40 KB and was written in 6502 assembly by Rachel Simone Weil, aka Party Time! Hexcellent! Download includes NES ROM, a readme.txt, and a four-page booklet about hacking, programming, and sleepovers entitled "Do Fun Things with Electronic Sweet-N-Fun Fortune Teller."

186186.Name: Eskimo Bob: Starring Alfonzo - Deluxe Edition
186186.Overview: Eskimo Bob NES has been updated to the Deluxe Editon! This version has been upgraded to include new background animations as well as a new 2 player tag-team mode. Everything else is exactly the same. Enjoy!

186336.Name: Gaplus
186336.Overview: This port of Gaplus for the NES was created by M2 and included exclusively in the compilation Namco Museum Archives Volume 2 as a bonus game.

186763.Name: Fantasy Zone (Tengen)
186763.Overview:
Two different versions were released for the Famicom/NES. The Japanese version was released in 1987, developed and published by Sunsoft. The American unlicensed version was released in 1989, developed and published by Tengen.

Imagine the wildest, wackiest place in the Universe and you've got Fantasy Zone. As Opa-Opa, a living spaceship, you'll marvel at the incredible landscapes filled with the strangest creatures. Watch out. They may look cute and innocent, but they're Menons, nasty aliens that have overrun the eight planets that make up Fantasy Zone.

Your job is to clear each world of Menons. Every time you zap one, it runs into a coin. Collect enough coins and you can buy power-up items like deadlier weapons and mightier engines. At the end of every planet lurks a super-powerful boss. Find a way to blast past these monsters in order to continue your exciting journey in the Fantasy Zone.

186924.Name: Sir Ababol: Remastered Edition
186924.Overview: Sir Ababol: Remastered Edition is an updated release of the 2013 NES homebrew title Sir Ababol. This release improves the original game by correcting a number of map bugs and imperfections. It also adds new colours and tweaks the movement to optimize it and make it more responsive. By completing the game two additional playable characters can be unlocked. Completing it once unlocks Zazelle and a second time Johnny Limite. They each have different moves providing different gameplay.

186936.Name: KHAN Games 4-in-1 Retro Gamepak
186936.Overview:
Reaching back into the KHAN Games vault, Kevin himself picked three discontinued games and re-worked them, hoping to give those who missed them the first time around another opportunity to play some of his earlier work.

Presented here, in the 4-in-1 KHAN Games Retro Gamepak, re-live the fun and enjoyment you had the first time you played the classic Atari games, Ultimate Frogger Champion, Sneak n Peek, and E.T. on the NES.

No more searching for individual, over-priced copies of these games! Enjoy them all now, in one convenient cartridge, along with a new bonus game: Fishing Challenge!

187080.Name: Brilliant Pebbles
187080.Overview:
In 1985, the U.S. military launched the Brilliant Pebbles defense platform. It was part of the Star Wars space-based weapons initiative. It consisted of an unknown large number of satellites orbiting Earth. Each satellite was essentially a space cannon, able to shoot large projectiles at targets on the planet. Although officially discontinued in 1993, Brilliant Pebbles remained secretly operational.

In the year 199X, Earth was threatened by a large wave of asteroids and comets. The commanders decided to use the Brilliant Pebbles defense platform to defend the planet. The military converted the satellites into unmanned space drones. The drones were controllable from command centers on the ground.

The waves of space rocks were relentless...almost endless. They required military-space action over most of the planet's outer reaches. Each soldier was granted control over a small set of drones. If one drone was obliterated, the soldier could commandeer another. After destroying enough rocks, the soldier could earn another ship. Promotions were based on the soldier's score, which measured threats neutralized.

188497.Name: 11-in-1 Ball Games
188497.Overview:
A Multi-Game Pirate Cart containing:
A: Soccer Ball,
B: Volley Ball,
C: Base Ball,
D: Lunar Ball,
E: Golf Ball,
F: Tennis,
G: Paddle,
H: Howball,
I: Pinball,
J: Fyard Fight,
K: Side Pocket 1M or Double Dribble

This was released in both PAL and NTSC versions.

189360.Name: Pac-Man Championship Edition
189360.Overview: The NES Pac-Man Championship Edition was originally a demake port by Japanese homebrew developer coke774. When Namco got ahold of it for the officially-licensed Namcot Collection (and Namco Museum Archives Vol. 1), development was shifted to M2, who altered a number of aspects from coke774's original. The initial homebrew version was never released to the public, though a handful of emulator-recorded screenshots and videos have surfaced, giving an incomplete look at the alterations M2 made.

189594.Name: Pong de las Tortugas Ninja
189594.Overview:
Señor Saki has captured our heroes, those tubular Tortugas, in a classic 1970s Pong simulation!

Battle to 15 against the CPU or a friend in this recreation of two familiar properties.

189807.Name: Deadpool
189807.Overview:
Deadpool is a Ninja Gaiden hack for the NES, changing nearly every aspect of the original game in order to create a unique adventure. It was created by  Techmoon and released in 2019.

It adds more stages, enemies and weapons, along with new music, animated backgrounds, parallax scrolling and more. The story is told via numerous cutscenes and you can find secret areas, Easter eggs, and lots of in-game references for the fans to discover.

An update to the game, called Deadpool: Hardcore Edition, was made by DANGER X and released a few months later. It's a tougher game with more playable characters and enemies.

189976.Name: Clovermon Hunter
189976.Overview: EDGIE EDDIE WANTS TO BEAT EVERY CLOVERMON. It’s right there on the status screen. Shoot your way through 31 levels of toxic raptors, burning pumpkins, screaming penguins and various other monstrosities - and then do it all over again another three times! Good luck with level 30! :^)

190647.Name: Super Royal Pals. 3
190647.Overview:
Super Royal Pals. 3 is a "What If" hack. What if Nintendo decided to make the ladies of the Mushroom Kingdom the stars of the story. Takes place on the 8 Worlds outside of the Mushroom Kingdom. 

The hack removes lives and score and replaces it with a death counter. It also improves movement with suits and makes the Fireball suit better. You can now hold up when shooting a fireball to shoot upward.

You will also get a random power up at the end of 3 end-goal stages.

190899.Name: super mario bros 1-3
190899.Overview:
Okay, so... Long story short, it's SMB1 with SMB3 elements, like World Maps (Hammer Bros. included), Super Leaf & Frog Suit. It has a 2P CO-OP feature as well, like the NSMB series. It also has a few more features, but those are only available with a secret code that you get when you beat the game.

And graphically speaking, I'm speechless. This looks AWESOME! Colorful backgrounds, 16-bit like sprites, and a bit more... Sound department is the same, but with SMB3 tunes added in for good measure. You can't complain, and I sure didn't.

So... Yeah, I'm pretty sure you want to get this and play it so bad. And this time around, it should be easy to pick up and play. You just need to follow this instruction carefully and you are good to go.

192389.Name: Asder 20 in 1
192389.Overview: The multicart itself starts with an intro featuring a pair of dancing shoes. All of the games from Caltron 6-in-1 are present on this multicart, although the music and sound effects in Bookyman are identical to Brush Roller's, which is what the game is a hack of. There's also a hack of Magic Carpet 1001 titled Magic Carpet 1001 Turbo which maxes out the player's weapon at the start and prevents it from being downgraded. Four of the games listed (Bingo, Hi-Lo Poker, Puzzler and Kentucky Derby) were originally part of Pokey, a gambling game created by NTDEC in 1989. Hi-Lo Poker was the main game, and the other three were mini games. The last three games are all light gun games.

192583.Name: 190-in-1
192583.Overview:
Despite the multicart's claim, only 42 games are actually included. The menu system is unorthodox, with the first 15 games on the first page leading to the other pages which can be accessed by pressing the Select button. Like some Supervision multicarts, the menu music is taken from Booby Kids. The graphics are taken from the Magic Jewelry hack that's included among the games.

Unlike most multicarts where the repeats have random letters added on to the end, this multicart uses alternate names such as Luigi Bros and Zero Wing. (The latter of which is not the Mega Drive game of the same name) The memory is likely all stored in PRG format, as the games take about 3 seconds to load when picked.

192622.Name: Zelda: Remastered
192622.Overview: Experience the game that kicked off the iconic Zelda series in a whole new way. With increased resolution, animated environments, upgraded sound, and other quality of life enhancements - Zelda: Remastered is a completely new experience that acts as a tribute to one of the most influential games of all time.

192885.Name: Wampus
192885.Overview:
Wampus is an overhead arcade narrative adventure game developed for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES).

The wampus live on a planet invaded by colonialists, farming and mining the land for its natural resources. These resource-stripping activities threaten the local flora and fauna, especially the Mountain Wampus, who get hunted for their treasure.

As a young wampus, players set out to rid the planet of the settler invaders and restore harmony to the land. While a fun lark, Wampus explores themes of environmentalism, conservationism, stewardship of the land, and the destructive nature of colonialism.

Wampus is the first in a trilogy of NES homebrew games about native creatures fighting alien colonists who threaten their world. The trilogy includes:

1. Wampus
2. Wart Worm Wingding
3. Bat Lizard Bonanza

AlternateNames.AlternateName: Mad Wizard, The: A Candelabra Chronicle

192887.Name: Mad Wizard
192887.Overview:
Take an adventure in the world of Candelabra!

The evil summoner Amondus from The Order of the Talon has taken over Prim, Hekl's once happy homeland. And nothing drives a wizard more crazy than having their territory trampled on!

Can you help Hekl defeat the enemies that Amondus has populated throughout the landscape? To do so, you will need to master the art of levitation, find magic spells that will assist you in reaching new areas, and upgrade your weapons. All of these will be necessary in order to give Hekl the power he needs to restore peace to Prim. Do you have what it takes? If you dare, venture into this, the first installment of the Candelabra series!

Featuring:

Over 120 screens of varied terrain to explore
More than 10 different enemy types
Multiple boss fights
Infinite continues

192943.Name: Silicon Statue
192943.Overview:
Silicon Statue erects a musical homage to days long gone, with an intense crispness that immerses the listener in a world of magic and mystery. The fifth album by Zi is incredibly diverse in tone and timbre, keeping the listener’s ears alert and their heart’s happy.

This album was made with the Famitracker and uses only the original NES chipset.

192944.Name: Fake News Covfefe
192944.Overview: Fake News Covfefe is a hack of Zombie Nation. It replaces the sprites with the Don. Adds a new story intro as well. A fun piece of pop culture.

193037.Name: 8Bit Music Power
193037.Overview:
For the first time in over two decades, Nintendo's flagship console, the legendary Famicom, will be getting an exclusive mixtape of music penned and programmed by top tier musicians - fitting as this cartridge features retro 8 bit chip tunes meant to be played on the beloved machine of yester year.

Only a thousand copies of this hot fire mixtape will be droppedby Columbus Circle, a Japan-based maker of videogame accessories, and 8 BIT MUSIC POWER will come with 12 original songs written in 2015.

While not an officially licensed Nintendo title, the songs written by these old school enthusiast deserve the Nintendo Seal of Approval™; the team featured in 8 Bit Power includes talent by the likes of Yuriko Keino, Namco Arcade Games Composer and Ape Escape Composer Omodaka, amongst others. As well, all the nostalgic pixel art is created by Hiroshi Ono, who also has had a hand in the Namco arcade pixel scene.

The first of it's kind, this unique musical offering is getting a lot of buzz; it's nice to see that in the videogame world, there will always be enthusiasts who truly love gaming, no matter what~ PLAY IT LOUD!

193089.Name: NOFX Cover Cart Vol. 1
193089.Overview:
Cover Cart Vol. 1
Featuring all the NSFs from my NOFX cover set at the 2011 Halloween edition of PULSEWAVE.

Song Listing
Moron Bros., The Longest Line, Kill All the White Man, Stickin' In My Eye, Bob, Linoleum, Leave it Alone, Don't Call Me White, Lori Meyers, 180 Degrees, Falling In Love, Franco Unamerican

Hidden Bonus Track
I had about 2 weeks to come up with the set and did not get a chance to finish Kids of the K Hole in time. The unfinished track is hidden as an easter egg in the the welcome screen code of the ROM.
 
The Bonus Track can be unlocked with Game Genie code: PENTKIAA

193092.Name: Retrogathering 2010
193092.Overview:
Thanks to the following people that submitted songs for the cart:

nordloef
Den där Marcus
Perry
jockepockee
carlsson
mibe

193122.Name: Duck Tails
193122.Overview:
This album was also released as a NES cartridge album. The credits screen is available as an Easter egg by pressing and holding A+B+Select on the NES' controller #1. These additional credits are duplicated here:

• The Puzzle Boys are: Chaz Aria and Lo G Man Crusan
• Not possible without: ZZO38, No-Carrier, Sam Egan, Scuba Steve, Nick Horace, Forgotten Freshness, J. Pirro, The Witch Dr., Retrohacker, M-Death, Greg Cameron, Hoibe Hoiyi Au

193123.Name: MOON8
193123.Overview: This is a transcription of the entire Pink Floyd album Dark Side of the Moon for the Nintendo Entertainment System. No expansion chips were used; this album works entirely within the limitations of the standard North American NES.

193445.Name: Family BASIC
193445.Overview:
Family BASIC allowed users to program in a BASIC programming language (NS-HUBASIC) that was developed specifically for use on the Famicom. The cartridge came with a keyboard and required the use of the Famicom Data Recorder in order to save any created programs.

The cartridge was originally released as Family BASIC, but was later re-released as Family BASIC V3 with added memory. This version also came packaged with some games already included. Games are accessed by typing GAME followed by a space then a number (0, 1, 2, or 3).

The following are the games that were included:

GAME 0 is the Heart Game. Using either a microphone or the keyboard, players get to fill in a heart with Mario and Pauline (of Donkey Kong fame) meeting in the middle for a smooch.

GAME 1 is the Number Game. Players control a penguin on a grid collecting numbers in sequential order while trying to avoid the Sidesteppers from Mario Bros..

GAME 2 is the Mario Game. Players are able to control Mario in game levels that they themselves make.

GAME 3 is Star Killer. 1 or 2 players control their spaceship trying to shoot as many enemies as they can.

193720.Name: Kamikaze Bros. 3
193720.Overview:
Kamikaze Bros. 3 is a kaizo style SMB3 romhack.

This hack was designed to be fun and very challenging. The player must perform tight jumps, advanced techniques and abuse the game’s mechanics in order to save the princess and emerge victorious.

Kamikaze Bros. 3 would not have been possible without the efforts of others: Obitus1, the creator of Kaizo SMB3, GrandPooBear, ChaosComposer, Mitch Flowerpower, Hi5toSafety and many others helped with the creation and testing of this romhack.

The creator sincerely hopes you enjoy this romhack, and deeply apologizes for Boss Bass.

194918.Name: From Below
194918.Overview:
The Kraken cometh...

From the deepest trenches of the ocean, the Kraken has come to lay waste to your city!

The archers have slung every arrow.
The burning tar has run dry.
Every piece of military weaponry has been dispatch.

And yet... the Kraken moves forward, climbing the towering walls of your seaside fortress.

With no ammunition left, the city itself moves from a barricade, to a weapon!

The stones of the walls are broken off, and hurdled down at hideous creature. And it just might be enough to
slow it down till morning, when surely help will arrive...

195249.Name: Battle City: 4 Players Hack
195249.Overview:
Play classic Battle City with a four-score or 4-player adapter. Also adds some features (selectable) and 35 levels from Tank 1990 (levels 35-70).

Additionally an addendum patch exists which adds:

-Ability to Choose between 1-4 players
-Ability to Move cursor with Up/Down buttons
-Every option is YES by default on every emulator
-Other small changes to make the game work correctly with any number of players

195253.Name: Balloon Fight: 4 Players Hack
195253.Overview: A hack of Balloon Fight for 3 and 4 players. Compatible with both four-score and 4-player adapter. Also adds some features.

195254.Name: Battletoads 4 Players
195254.Overview:
Mod/hack adds fourth (and third) player to Battletoads to make it possible to play the game with four people at the same time.

In later versions: Custom respawn (for choice), color select for toads (including extended palettes), oneshot deals damage instead (for choice), friendly fire (for choice), change of interaction with lower edge of the screen, different finishing hits to use, multiplier and difficulty of enemies (for choice), level select.

195301.Name: Oof McBrewster's Haunted House Adventure
195301.Overview: Oof McBrewster receives a letter from his dear Uncle Crodie, only to learn that his uncle has died, leaving behind a haunted mansion, a friggin’ fortune, and a call to adventure for our fearless hero.

195302.Name: Panesian Power
195302.Overview: Pull out your zappers and lube, for an exciting NSFW experience.

195303.Name: 8bit Music Power Encore
195303.Overview: RIKI's third 8-bit music title! Introducing ENCORE. It's not a game, it's an 8-bit chiptune album. Basically, please enjoy while looking at the screen without operating.

195304.Name: Moonfall: A Legend of Zelda Compilation
195304.Overview: Moonfall is a compilation album of music from the Legend of Zelda franchise coded onto a cartridge so that it is playable on the original NES console. It is a collection some of my favorite tracks, from some of my favorite titles such as Ocarina of Time, Majora's Mask, Twilight Princess, Link's Awakening, Link to the Past, Minish Cap, and Windwaker. The idea was to arrange and code each track in such a way that I could put the collection onto a cartridge and play them on the original console, where it all began.

195305.Name: Haradius Zero
195305.Overview: A horizontally scrolling shooter, with huge enemies, and lots going on in the screen at once. You have two satellites which you can bring in close to shoot, or send far up and down for enemies out of reach.

195368.Name: Mortal Kombat 4
195368.Overview:
Mortal Kombat 4 is a pirated fighting game that was developed by Hummer Team and published by Ka Sheng, with MK4 later re-released by ABAB Soft on a multicart.

This game is probably best known for having some strange music choices such as the theme from the first Superman movie and a track from James Cameron's Titanic film.

195593.Name: South Park Zelda
195593.Overview:
A very bizarre hack of the classic The Legend of Zelda, with Kyle from South Park as the main character and the occasional character that we will find.

The map is totally changed (except the dungeons); in addition, the textures have been simplified in reference to the animation series.

Kyle does not look much like him in the video because he was already wearing the red hat (red ring in the original) and the colors of the cute character become red.

The final scene, which by the way was difficult for me to get to (since some dungeons are in crazy places) and in which Ganon is replaced by what seems to be Kyle's mother (or the Cartman, who knows).

195617.Name: Tecmo Super Bowl 2019
195617.Overview: Tecmo Super Bowl is the follow-up to the NES football arcade/simulation Tecmo Bowl. While the basic gameplay of the original is intact, a host of new features and improvements have been added. Features include: 32 real NFL teams/mascots with real NFL players (circa 2019), 11 players on the field per team, player substitutions, fumbles, improved control over kicks and punts, eight plays to choose from during games, customizable playbooks, arcade/coach/computer simulation options for one or two players, pre-season/regular season/Pro-Bowl games, regular season team standings and rankings, regular season player statistics and rankings, end-of-game boxscores, and a 12-team playoff following the NFL format.

195618.Name: Tecmo Super Bowl 2018
195618.Overview: Tecmo Super Bowl is the follow-up to the NES football arcade/simulation Tecmo Bowl.
