195740.Name: Tecmo Super Bowl 1997
195740.Overview: Tecmo Super Bowl is the follow-up to the NES football arcade/simulation Tecmo Bowl. While the basic gameplay of the original is intact, a host of new features and improvements have been added. Features include: 31 real NFL teams/mascots with real NFL players (circa 1997), 11 players on the field per team, player substitutions, fumbles, improved control over kicks and punts, eight plays to choose from during games, customizable playbooks, arcade/coach/computer simulation options for one or two players, pre-season/regular season/Pro-Bowl games, regular season team standings and rankings, regular season player statistics and rankings, end-of-game boxscores, and a 12-team playoff following the NFL format.

195741.Name: Tecmo Super Bowl 1996
195741.Overview: Tecmo Super Bowl is the follow-up to the NES football arcade/simulation Tecmo Bowl. While the basic gameplay of the original is intact, a host of new features and improvements have been added. Features include: 31 real NFL teams/mascots with real NFL players (circa 1996), 11 players on the field per team, player substitutions, fumbles, improved control over kicks and punts, eight plays to choose from during games, customizable playbooks, arcade/coach/computer simulation options for one or two players, pre-season/regular season/Pro-Bowl games, regular season team standings and rankings, regular season player statistics and rankings, end-of-game boxscores, and a 12-team playoff following the NFL format.

195742.Name: Tecmo Super Bowl 1995
195742.Overview: Tecmo Super Bowl is the follow-up to the NES football arcade/simulation Tecmo Bowl. While the basic gameplay of the original is intact, a host of new features and improvements have been added. Features include: 31 real NFL teams/mascots with real NFL players (circa 1995), 11 players on the field per team, player substitutions, fumbles, improved control over kicks and punts, eight plays to choose from during games, customizable playbooks, arcade/coach/computer simulation options for one or two players, pre-season/regular season/Pro-Bowl games, regular season team standings and rankings, regular season player statistics and rankings, end-of-game boxscores, and a 12-team playoff following the NFL format.

195743.Name: Tecmo Super Bowl 1994
195743.Overview: Tecmo Super Bowl is the follow-up to the NES football arcade/simulation Tecmo Bowl. While the basic gameplay of the original is intact, a host of new features and improvements have been added. Features include: 28 real NFL teams/mascots with real NFL players (circa 1994), 11 players on the field per team, player substitutions, fumbles, improved control over kicks and punts, eight plays to choose from during games, customizable playbooks, arcade/coach/computer simulation options for one or two players, pre-season/regular season/Pro-Bowl games, regular season team standings and rankings, regular season player statistics and rankings, end-of-game boxscores, and a 12-team playoff following the NFL format.

195744.Name: Tecmo Super Bowl 1993
195744.Overview: Tecmo Super Bowl is the follow-up to the NES football arcade/simulation Tecmo Bowl. While the basic gameplay of the original is intact, a host of new features and improvements have been added. Features include: 28 real NFL teams/mascots with real NFL players (circa 1993), 11 players on the field per team, player substitutions, fumbles, improved control over kicks and punts, eight plays to choose from during games, customizable playbooks, arcade/coach/computer simulation options for one or two players, pre-season/regular season/Pro-Bowl games, regular season team standings and rankings, regular season player statistics and rankings, end-of-game boxscores, and a 12-team playoff following the NFL format.

195745.Name: Tecmo Super Bowl 1992
195745.Overview: Tecmo Super Bowl is the follow-up to the NES football arcade/simulation Tecmo Bowl. While the basic gameplay of the original is intact, a host of new features and improvements have been added. Features include: 28 real NFL teams/mascots with real NFL players (circa 1992), 11 players on the field per team, player substitutions, fumbles, improved control over kicks and punts, eight plays to choose from during games, customizable playbooks, arcade/coach/computer simulation options for one or two players, pre-season/regular season/Pro-Bowl games, regular season team standings and rankings, regular season player statistics and rankings, end-of-game boxscores, and a 12-team playoff following the NFL format.

195798.Name: Mortal Kombat Trilogy
195798.Overview:
Mortal Kombat Trilogy - MK5 Mortal Kombat , named Mortal Kombat 5 on the final screen, is a bootleg of the fighting genre for the Famicom / Nintendo Entertainment System consoles released by Hosekn of USA between October and November 1998.

This video game is an adaptation of the original Mortal Kombat 3 (1995, Midway ), which briefly displays a title screen with the Mortal Kombat Trilogy logo as soon as the game starts. Most of the music backgrounds are repurposed from the Mortal Kombat V bootleg , and the title screen music is a remixed version of its similar from the fighter selection screen from the original Mortal Kombat arcade (1992, Midway ).

Available characters include Sindel , Liu Kang , Kano , Sonya , Nightwolf , Kung Lao (as Kung-Lao ), Stryker , Sub-Zero, and Shang Tsung (as Shang ). Unlike other Mortal Kombat- based bootlegs , this one in particular features graphic blood effects and a single Fatality for all characters: an uppercut that explodes the character. You may notice a typo in the pre- Fatality announcement. The text " Finish Him! " ( Suggested translation: " Finish it! " ), Which in English refers to the masculine gender, appears when Sindel is defeated; on the contrary, when Sonya is defeated, the correct text " Finish Her! " ( suggested translation: " Finish her! " ) appears, which in English refers to the female gender.

The scenarios that appear in Mortal Kombat 5 are The Rooftop , The Temple , Graveyard and Soul Chamber , which sometimes appear with the color palette changed when you face a different character. The end of the game is a screen of congratulations and thanks for playing.

196484.Genres: Action; Adventure; Shooter; Sports; Board Game
196484.Name: Caltron: 9 in 1
196484.Overview: 9 in 1 is an unlicensed multicart based on Caltron 6 in 1. This multicart contains nine NTDEC games: Skate Boy, Dream Fighter, Tank, Super Gun, Magic Block, Go! Benny, Sea of Dreamland, Destroyer, and Hit Marmot.

196604.Name: Gradius ArchiMENdes Hen
196604.Overview:
Gradius was no stranger to ports and versions of the game, so why would it be weird if Konami featured noodles inside the NES flavor? The year was 1986 and Konami decided to promote the instant noodles brand Arukimendesu / Archimendes, which literally means “instant noodles to walk/to go”. How, you ask? Well, this version of the game has Archimendes noodle packages instead of power-ups…

And a strange message at the end: OMEDETO! KEY WORD WA ‘GAME SNACK ARCHIMENDES DE POWER UP’

Other than that, this NES version is exactly the same compared to the original.

196704.Name: 0-to-X
196704.Overview:
Based on a hit internet phenomenon, 0-to-X is an addictive puzzler developed by nemesys. In addition to tile mashing fun, the game features an amazing soundtrack by Memblers. Some of it is almost twenty years old too, finally seeing the light of day with this release. Flash saves will store your high scores for years to come, thanks to the capabilities of Memblers’ GTROM boards.

There are 3 versions of the game - Regular Version, Numbered Version, and the Limited Version.  The Numbered Version was sold on NintendoAge and is individually numbered on the title screen.

197016.Name: Batman versus Predator
197016.Overview:
After a hellacious battle with a fierce Predator that almost destroyed Gotham City, Batman narrowly escaped with his life. He thought he had seen the last of the alien beings, but time always has a way of repeating itself...
		
The Predators, having lost one of their greatest warriors, vowed revenge on the Dark Knight. They gathered together a massive army, and set their sights on Gotham City. The sky began to darken as the Predator army engulfed the entire city. They had only one mission to accomplish... To eliminate Batman!!!

As the bat signal flashed into the sky, Batman had no idea what he was about to face....

197205.Name: Super Mario Unlimited Deluxe
197205.Overview:
Super Mario Unlimited Deluxe is a traditional-style Mario hack with difficulty ramping up from beginner to expert. It is based on the Super Mario Bros engine, but has been completely reworked into a whole new adventure.

Changes from the original game include:

-41 Original Levels!
-Unlimited Lives!
-New Power-up! The stopwatch lets Mario freeze his enemies
-New Mechanics! Mario can super jump off enemies by holding A
-New Collectable! Find all 32 Mario coins to unlock secrets
-New Graphics and Music! A familiar mix of new and old

197534.Name: Maniac Mansion
197534.Overview:
This is the original port of Maniac Mansion for the Famicom released only in Japan in 1988. It's entirely different from the port that was released on the NES in Europe and the United States in 1990 and is a unique game.

Maniac Mansion is a graphic adventure video game. It follows teenage protagonist Dave Miller as he attempts to rescue his girlfriend Sandy Pantz from a mad scientist, whose mind has been enslaved by a sentient meteor. The player uses a point-and-click interface to guide Dave and two of his six playable friends through the scientist's mansion while solving puzzles and avoiding dangers. Gameplay is non-linear, and the game must be completed in different ways based on the player's choice of characters. 

The game was conceived in 1985 by Ron Gilbert and Gary Winnick, who sought to tell a comedic story based on horror film and B-movie clichés. They mapped out the project as a paper-and-pencil game before coding commenced. While earlier adventure titles had relied on command lines, Gilbert disliked such systems, and he developed Maniac Mansion's simpler point-and-click interface as a replacement. To speed up production, he created a game engine called SCUMM, which was used in many later LucasArts titles. After its release, Maniac Mansion was ported to several platforms.

197606.Name: Super floofy sheepie
197606.Overview:
Super Floofy Sheepie is a game written entirely in assembly language, for the NES. Coded for #bitbitjam4 with the theme of "velcro sheep" with an input restriction of just one button.

You must time your button presses to collect all the floof balls in each level whilst avoiding wolves, then escaping to your sheepy house, and moving onto the next level of course.

198085.Name: Pizza Pop Mario
198085.Overview:
Pizza Pop Mario, also known as Mary Pizza Pop, is a hack of Pizza Pop for the Famicom which replaces the pizza delivery guy, "Kid-kun", with Mario. The game starts with 10 lives instead of 3, and the time limit for every stage is now nine minutes. The graphics are taken from Super Mario Bros. 3.

Mario has decided to start delivering pizzas to make some spare cash, in order to buy Princess Peach a nice gift! Toad, being very jealous, since Mario hasn't been spending much time with him, decides to try and sabotage Mario's plans. Will Mario succeed in getting Peach the gift, or will Toad be able to thwart Mario's plan?

198088.Name: Angry Video Game Nerd VS Dr. Wily
198088.Overview:
This game is one of the hardest ROM hacks I’ve ever made. It’s very hard and challenging.

This is a Hack sequel to Mega Man II, set after Mega Man defeated Dr. Wily again.

Dr. Wily set up a trap to kill Mega Man. Mega Man was subsequently killed by Dr. Wily. So now Dr. Wily rebuilt all eight Robot Masters again, and made all stages much more difficult.

However, only one hero can stop the evil Dr. Wily and save the world. He is… Angry Video Game Nerd!

199010.Name: The Legend of Zelda: The Awakening of Onox
199010.Overview:
After many years, the evil General Onyx has returned. He has invaded the Kingdom of Hyrule to get revenge on Link. He kidnapped Zelda, as well as the Triforce of Power. With the power of the Triforce, Onyx placed a magic barrier in his underground dungeon, to prevent Link from getting close enough to rescue Zelda. Link went to Impa for wisdom. She informs Link that the only way to break the barrier is to seek out and find eight magical “Spirit Skulls”. The Spirit Skulls are said to possess small traces of power similar of that found in the Triforce. With all of the Spirit Skulls used together, the power should be enough to break the barrier, allowing Link to brave the fierce dungeon, and rescue Princess Zelda from the General of Darkness, Onyx

Originally a project worked on partially by Trifindo, this was picked up on, revised, and fully completed to where the game is now fully playable. Only the 1st quest has been done on this game.

199222.Name: 8BIT RIKI ILLUSTRATIONS
199222.Overview: This rom was released with "Kira Kira Star Night" in a magazine release.  The rom is an 8-bit illustration "art book" showcasing the developers work.

199257.Name: Adventure
199257.Overview:
Atari 2600 port created by pacnsacdave.

An evil magician has stolen the Enchanted Chalice, and has hidden it somewhere in the kingdom. The object of the game is ti recover the Enchanted Chalice, and return it to the Golden Castle, where it belongs. This will be no easy task, as the evil magician has created three dragons to hinder you from accomplishing your goal.

199298.Name: 8-Bit XMAS 2020
199298.Overview:
There's nothing more emblematic of the Holiday seasons than the cozy feeling you get waking to a fire and conifer brimming under with presents. That feeling of togetherness and warmth and holiday spirit shared while singing songs of the season with friends and family. That feeling of wonder as you lay in bed and hope you are not getting sick!

Got a case of the holiday blues? Dr. Covio has the cure! Line up pills horizontally or vertically to kill viruses. That might sound easy but don't take too long or the viruses will start to multiply! If you're feeling lonely invite some friends (or family is ok too), there's enough room for up to 4 doctors in this office! 

Game Features:
1-4 players
Multiple playfield widths
Player speed setting
20 virus levels
xmas music!

199299.Name: 8-Bit Hero Trainer
199299.Overview:
A giant bat tries to take a bite out of your face. You have less than a second to react.

Tired of "role playing" games which only teach you how to follow command menus or press action buttons? Want proper, relevant preparation for your own quest? For the first time ever, modern technology is making it possible for you to get real, active, first-person athletic and combat training against real 8-bit monster simulations in the comfort of your own home!

Observe enemy weak points, and execute real attacks with your own sword! (sold separately) Observe enemy intentions and move your body quickly to avoid retaliation! 

Technology so advanced you'll think it's already 1990! Using the Nintendo Power Glove AND Power Pad (both sold separately), now you're playing with TWICE the power!

Vanquish foes to gain power for the next battle!

199300.Name: Ball'N'Flag
199300.Overview: Ball'N'Flag is a little game for NES (Nintendo Entertainment System developed in less 2 days by lbarasc.

199301.Name: Anguna Zero
199301.Overview:
Anguna Zero is the next installment in the Anguna series, taking the Anguna 2600 adventure, and improving it and bringing it to the NES.

Anguna Zero contains:

A large overworld with multiple dungeons
An in-game inventory screen with a built-in world map
An experience points system that allows you to gain levels
Multiple items, powerups, and keys

199309.Name: Arkanoid Revised
199309.Overview:
In this hack, the game’s graphics have been improved and the game design was revised with more modern play kept in mind. More sense is made out of the continue and level skip cheats, which were almost always used on every play, so now those features have been properly adapted into the main game.

The list of changes is as follows:

ADDED:
-holding the B button greatly increases vaus’ move speed
-new warp pill system

CHANGED:
-continue option available from the title menu after a game over (the cursor is moved to it automatically to prevent “new game” accidents)
-starts with 6 lives (on new game and continue)
-displays up to 9 lives on the HUD (originally only 6)
-graphics

NEW WARP PILL SYSTEM:
-the warp pill no longer creates the warp gate automatically
grabbing a warp pill sends it to the inventory
-pressing SELECT spends a warp pill and opens a warp gate
-entering the warp gates sends you 2 levels ahead instead of just skipping the current level
-starts with 3 warp pills on a new game
-the amount of warp pills is kept upon continuing
-warp gate point bonus reduced from 10,000 to 5,000
-displays up to 6 warp pills on the HUD (new feature)
-chances for warp pill drop slightly increased

199425.Name: Alwa's Awakening Soundtrack
199425.Overview:
The soundtrack to Alwa’s Awakening has been greatly received so we thought it would get its’ own page here on the site. It consists of 25 original tracks and all of them but one was composed by Robert Kreese. The guest track was made by famous chip musician Prof. Sakamoto.
The soundtrack is released both digitally and on an actual NES cartridge.

Composed by Robert Kreese
Guest track by Prof. Sakamoto
Available on a NES cartridge

199431.Name: 1007 Bolts
199431.Overview:
So you've pissed off the Gods... Now what?

Your options are limited. You can beg for mercy or try bargaining with the devil. Maybe standing around in a puddle of your own making is more your style. However, while you're mulling over your choices, you may want to watch your step because today, lightning will strike the same place more than once!

Your goal is to simply live until the next day. To avoid being smited, move left or right. Nothing else will work. You do happen to have the power to stop time with the Start button. Survive long enough and the gods will become even more furious!

199432.Name: AirGap 2020 Commemorative NES Cartridge
199432.Overview: This is a commemorative NES ROM for the AirGap2020 digital conference, which occurred on May 2nd, 2020, that contains the event's talk schedule and the entire 11 hours of Twitch Chat data that plays back in 1:1 time (have fun waiting the entire time for the last message to appear...)

199433.Name: Alf Escapes!
199433.Overview:
Hack of "The Blues Brothers"

The Tanner family is an average American family. One day, they discover that they have a visitor. He’s small, he’s furry, he’s arrogant, and he’s an alien from the planet Melmac. Unsure what to do, they name him ALF: Alien Life Form. Alf soon decides that as much as he misses his home planet, there’s a lot to be said for Earth: the Tanners are willing to concede anything as long as he doesn’t announce his presence. Oh yeah, the the Tanners also have a cat, which looks rather tasty… Anyways, while living with the Tanners, Alf is captured by the A.T.F. (Alien Task Force). While there, Alf discovers that his ship has been repaired. Seeing this may be his only chance to escape, Alf begins to cooperate with the A.T.F. After working with the A.T.F. for some time, they began to trust ALF. Once ALF had earned the trust of the A.T.F., he learned of a secret experiment that used alien technology to make super strong beings. Upon learning this, he decided it was time to make his escape! ALF performed the experiment on himself, and immediately became stronger. Will ALF escape the A.T.F. base before the effects of the procedure wears off?

199722.Name: Blazing Rangers
199722.Overview:
You are a firefighter with the task to rescue all kids from a dangerous fire site.

Equipped with a water hose, you can choose between two characters and will fight an ever-growing wall of fire and a plethora of dangerous enemies to open up the way and save the children. It's also important not to dawdle around - they might get burned if you don't take some risks and hurry to their rescue!

199736.Name: Tecmo Grey Cup
199736.Overview: Tecmo Grey Cup is a romhack for Tecmo Super Bowl that adapts the game to the rosters and rulesets of the Canadian Football League. 110 Yards, 20 Yard Endzones, and 3 Down sets are all included.

AlternateNames.AlternateName: ドキ!ドキ! クレイジーランド

200073.Name: Doki! Doki! Yūenchi: Crazy Land Daisakusen
200073.Overview: Play as a young boy trapped in an amusement park, fighting monsters and other foes all while trying to save his girlfriend from an unknown evil force. Armed with his kickable helmet, the boy is able to deal more damage the more damage he takes.

200330.Name: Nesert Golfing: Tournament Edition
200330.Overview:
NESert Golfing is an NES game heavily inspired by Desert Golfing.

Can be played with the SNES Mouse, if you know how to connect one to an NES. Otherwise the regular controllers work too, and for the party animals who don't like to share a controller 4-player adapters are supported as well. Famicom works too.

For 1 to 4 players

This alternate version is intended for those who want to compete at separate consoles, or otherwise be able to repeat the same set of holes. Instead of randomly generating them, the Tournament Edition allows you to choose a seed value to play a specific course.

200461.Name: Vegavox II
200461.Overview: The third NES album coded for chip musician Alex Mauer. It was released in May 2009 on Pause Records.

200464.Name: Zombie Calavera Prologue
200464.Overview:
To be able to move to the purgatory, Santos must open a door and, for that, he needs spiritual energy. The only way to get enough spiritual energy is gathering up to sixteen crucifixes in the graveyard. The problem is that it won’t be an easy task.

The graveyard is infested of monsters. Santos, carrying a powerful shotgun, should be able to eliminate them without much of a hassle, although this won’t be always a good idea, because dead monsters will come back in the shape of winged spirits which will pursue you relentlessly and which are much more difficult to dodge. Luckily, they are almost blind so if you hide in the background and don’t move they will stop seeing you and they’ll go away.

Usually you can hide behind pinacles, big trees and the weeds growing in the corners or next to a wall. You will soon discover which places are good hideouts and which aren’t. If you think you are hiden but spirits keep approaching… Look for a better place!

Finding the best hideouts, being patient and shooting only when needed are the keys of success in your mission.

200465.Name: You are insignificant
200465.Overview:
This is a classic NES platformer, with all that entails - coded to run on an actual nes and (shortly to be) brought to you through an emulator. For now, just download the rom and run it in the emulator of your choice.


You are seeking the legend of Quacking Jack's gold. Good luck, traveller!


This is a short game of five stages, each only one room big. I intended to use more stages, and a title screen, however I had to cut them for compression reasons (i.e. I didn't use any).

200466.Name: WWE Wrestling
200466.Overview: With the launch of the new WWE Network last week, now you can enjoy some WWE action on the NES!!! This hack changes all of the Wrestlers on the Pro Wrestling game for NES to WWE Wrestlers. Lots of palette hacking, as well as the intro and the ring itself. This new version has fixed all of the wrestlers and improved a couple of graphical issues.

200467.Name: WWE Women's Revolution
200467.Overview: The women's revolution is upon us! This hack changes all of the wrestlers in Pro Wrestling for NES to females. All stats, in game play, and cutscenes have been changed to reflect this.

200468.Name: Wolfing
200468.Overview:
Ling awakes in Baron Baranov's dungeon. The baron fears all creatures of the night and Ling knows that her dark heritage is the reason for her
imprisonment. Can she escape from the dungeon? Can she break her curse?

200469.Name: Underground Mission
200469.Overview: Underground Mission is an unlicensed shooter puzzle game developed by Inventor, who used the Triangle Wave to make its characteristics sounds (which practically sounds very similar to the DPCM bass typical of Sunsoft chip), and published by Power Joy Ltd. for the NES platform. The objective of the game is to collect all the items dispersed around the stages and rescue a kidnapped soldier.

200471.Name: Uchūsen: Ultimate Ploid Battle
200471.Overview: Uchūsen is a video game designed and programmed by Napoleón Malpica from NAPE GAMES  and Manu Segura from 1985 ALTERNATIVO for 1 day in an internal GameJam at the Fnac'n Pixels 2019 event.  In Uchūsen you control the ship Kairos, designed with high technology to fight against the alien invasion Uchūsen. Your goal is to open up between the enemy base and end the invasion to win the intergalactic war.  Do you have all the necessary reflexes to control Kairos and open yourself up in the enemy base?

200475.Name: TYMKRS: The Rabbit Hole
200475.Overview: TYMKRS: The White Rabbit is a homebrew NES game that was made as a Christmas present to the Tymkrs.  A second copy was made as a gift for the annual White Elephant gift exchange event for the hackerspace the Tymkrs hosts, "The Rabbit Hole". As a celebration of that hackerspace, the project utilized The Rabbit Hole name and logo.

200476.Name: Trophy
200476.Overview:
Take control of the robot Trophy in this exciting new homebrew game. Save the peaceful planet of Gearus 9 from the evil machinations of Lord Q as you run, jump, and blast your way to victory. Collect power-ups along the way and defeat some of the largest bosses ever seen on the NES!

As Trophy, you must navigate challenging environmental obstacles and terrain, such as water, snow, moving platforms, and even zero gravity. Collect power-ups and upgrade Trophy's health and weapon systems, all while battling enemies throughout the levels. Be prepared, though, as at the end of each level you will have to square off against one of the largest bosses ever seen on the NES!

200477.Name: Trump Alley
200477.Overview: A hack of Hogan's Alley by Trumptendo.  Trumptendo's games poke fun at political current events.

200478.Name: Turquoise Palace
200478.Overview: Turquoise Palace is a music EP developed by MorphCat Games released in 2008.

200479.Name: TRACK+FEEL II
200479.Overview:
TRACK+FEEL II, first released July 2012 A cooperative, interactive, glitch-art and music creation tool for the NES.

Cycle through several beats and grooves, and new animations will appear on screen. As you dance on the NES Power Pad mat controller, you'll create strange melodies! Certain key combinations will glitch it all out.

TRACK+FEEL II aims to present glitches and generative chaos as tools of construction rather than destruction. Exhibited at Reset: Post-consumer Gamer Culture, Juegos Rancheros, IndieCade Night Games, TEDxAustin, and more. An IndieCade 2012 Official Selection.

200480.Name: Tortoises
200480.Overview:
Tortorises is a port of the Konami/Stern arcade game, Turtles, released in 1981. It is a maze game where you're a mommy tortoise trying to save her kids, or kidtortoises.

This game was released at the Cowlitz Gamers for Kids expo around April 2017.

200481.Name: Tic-Tac XO
200481.Overview:
Get your X's and O's with Tic-Tac XO, the first game by Sly Dog Studios

Sly Dog Studios debuts on the Nintendo Entertainment system with Tic-Tac XO! Not being a regular game of tic-tac-toe, you can gain power-ups to up your game and demolish the computer. Power-ups include the ability to take an extra turn, change one of the computer's tiles, clear a row, and clear a column.

If you have a need to play tic-tac-toe, but need an extra boost in your game, look no further than Tic-Tac XO!

200494.Name: Swords and Runes III
200494.Overview:
Limited to 101 copies, the Numbered Addition (NA) Edition of Swords and Runes III includes the following:

-Numbered title screen, 000-100
-Translucent gold/yellow cartridge
-Brand new GTROM board by Membler Industries
-Box, manual, and label
-Plastic cart sleeve
-Styrofoam block

200495.Name: Super Gun
200495.Overview:
Super Gun is a subpar shooter and one of the rarest games for the Nintendo Entertainment System. There were unlicensed Famicom and NES versions, neither had ever been dumped.  In North America, it was also part of the unreleased and unlicensed sequel to Caltron 6-in-1, Caltron 9-in-1.  

It was extracted from the only known Caltron 9-in-1 prototype in 2019 by Frank Cifaldi.  The only known difference between this version and the 72-pin version is the copyright date on the title screen.

200496.Name: Super Tilt Bro
200496.Overview:
Super Tilt Bro is a demake of the Super Smash Bros. series compatible with the good old Nintendo Entertainment System from the 1980s.

You and a friend take control of a clone of Sinbad, the badass mascot of Ogre3D. Two fellows, one platform: you will have to fight to throw the other out.

200499.Name: Super Russian Roulette
200499.Overview: Inspired by the best kinds of bar games (ones with simple rules that become more enjoyable the longer you play), by goofing around, and by my generation’s childlike enthusiasm for that piece of gray plastic, Super Russian Roulette (SRR) is a brand new party game for the NES. One unhinged 8-bit cowboy is prepared to call you yellow, call you crazy, mourn your death, or kick up his boots for the last time. One bullet waits in the light gun’s chamber. You, up to two friends, and The Cowboy take turns passing the pistol, spinning the chamber (or not!), and drinking to your own demise (or not).

200500.Name: Super NeSnake 2
200500.Overview:
In this classic snake game, eat numbers to make your snake longer! Battle through 25 obstacle filled levels with precise movements to survive. Three difficulty levels keep the challenges coming faster each time. Once you have mastered the movement, play with a friend in vs or cooperative mode, or play against the computer. Can you slither your way to greatness?

This homebrew first appeared as an entry by Matrixz in the 2004 Minigame Competition. That original NeSnake is also included on the cart! Updated graphics, more levels, and extra game play modes make this one of the best homebrews yet. When you are done playing, a simple 4 character password lets you keep your levels unlocked for continuation later.

200501.Name: Super Mario Bros. 25th Anniversary Edition
200501.Overview:
Available only in Japan and Australia, this special edition of Super Mario Bros. on Virtual Console came pre-installed on the red Wii console bundles released on November 11, 2010. Super Mario Brothers 25th Anniversary Edition introduced two changes: The "?" on each Question Block was replaced with a "25," and the copyright date on the title screen was changed from "1985" to "1985-2010."

Though Nintendo's Japanese website called the game "Super Mario Brothers 25th Anniversary Edition," one of their screenshots showed an alternate title of "25th Anniversary SUPER MARIO BROS." on the Wii Channel info screen.

200502.Name: Super Donkey Kong
200502.Overview: Super Donkey Kong (スーパードンキーコング), also titled as Jungle King (叢林金剛) in Chinese, is a bootleg port of Donkey Kong Land (called Super Donkey Kong GB in Japan) developed by Ei-How Yang and published by Hosenkan Electronics in 1997.

200510.Name: Super Hero
200510.Overview:
Super hero is a further modified version of The Hacker, a hacked version of Felix the Cat from Dragon Co., changing the titular hacker to a character whose head is similar to Buzz Lightyear's head from Toy Story. Most versions of Super Hero start on the second level of the game. Felix's knight suit was replaced by a laser outfit.

As mentioned above, Super Hero can be found as the second game on DreamGEAR's 75-in-1 controller. It is also commonly found on other DreamGEAR plug & play Famiclone systems as well as those by other manufacturers, such as Trump Grand, Qi Sheng Long or Macro Winners.

200655.Name: NESDev '19 Compo Cart
200655.Overview:
Since 2011, The NES Coding Competition has granted its contestants just 64 kilobytes to make the very best game that they can. On this compilation, you’ll find all of the entries from 2019—our sixth competition.

Many of them have received bug fixes or updates. Others are included as they originally appeared in the competition. All of them are astonishing achievements. Think you have what it takes to join their ranks? Of course you do! Hit up the NesDev forums for submission info or to find a collaborator today!

200947.Name: Feng Kuang Jidan Zo
200947.Overview:
Fēng Kuáng Jīdàn Zǐ [疯狂鸡蛋仔] (also known as "Flighty Chicken") is a Tamagotchi clone developed by Waixing for the Famicom.

When you start the game, you must first select a few eggs. Players must then take care of the eggs while it hatches. During this time, you have the option of flipping the egg upside-down, or changing the temperature. On the upper-left corner of the screen, there's a box that shows the current weather. If the temparature is at a certain point during the time of a different weather, the player loses and must start from scratch. When the eggs do hatch, players have the option of giving the chicken's name.

A new set of commands appears upon the chicken's hatch. Options include giving the hen food and clothes or taking it for an outing.(The latter is nothing more than a picture still.) There's also a option to save your game but for some strange reason, it does not function properly. It may be due to the fact that the game lacks a battery save.

201050.Name: Astro Ninja Man
201050.Overview: Astro Ninja Man was developed by the same people who created Kira Kira Star Night and was only available by limited reservation in 2018.  This shooter offers wild colors and visuals along with a high quality soundtrack.

201053.Name: Baby Yoda
201053.Overview: A hack of Dig Dug replacing the protagonist with Grogu from The Mandelorian series and all enemies with ones from the Star Wars galaxy.

201055.Name: Atari Flashback
201055.Overview:
The Atari Flashback was released in 2004. The console resembled an Atari 7800 in appearance and came with a pair of controllers which resembled those of the Atari 7800, though they were slightly smaller. The system had twenty games built-in, all originally developed by Warner Communication's Atari Inc. and Atari Corp. for the 2600 and 7800 game systems. The games which originally required analog paddle controllers were made to work with the included joysticks.

The console utilized an "NES-on-a-Chip" infrastructure, thus this dump of the multi-game rom can was possible. The rom uses mapper 538 so it will only run in certain emulators.

201057.Name: Basic Championship Wrestling
201057.Overview:
Introducing Basic Championship Wrestling! It’s a homebrew originally programmed in QBasic and ported to work in a NES. It’s kind of like a turn-based RPG wrestling game. You won’t find groundbreaking graphics in this one. In fact, and if you’re familiar with QBasic, the graphics are left to your imagination with text characters representing everything. However, this game is pretty fun.

You play the role of the face (good guy) taking on the heel (bad guy). Though it doesn’t say so, your CPU will do maneuvers to you that you don’t have the option to do including hitting you with a trash can or spitting mist in your face.

The game plays a bit like paper-rock-scissors.

201058.Name: Bat Lizard Bonanza
201058.Overview:
Bat Lizard Bonanza is an arcade shoot-em-up (or shmup) for the NES. It's inspired by games like Gradius and Parodius.

The settlers have been exploiting Irata’s natural resources for many solar cycles. The Wampus took back the mountains. The Wart Worms took back the mines. But now Lizzy the Bat Lizard must embark on a quest to end the Settler scourge once and for all, dauntless in the wind with the echoes of her ancestors at her back.

Bat Lizard Bonanza features a rocking soundtrack, seven levels, and over 14 boss fights.

201059.Name: Battle of the Bits: Winter Chip IV
201059.Overview: Invitation rom file for "Battle of the Bits: Winter Chip IV."

201062.Name: Battle of the Bits: Winter Chip V
201062.Overview: Invitation rom for "Battle of the Bits: Winter Chip V."

201071.Name: Billionaire Banshee
201071.Overview: The hit adult party game Billionaire Banshee comes to NES! This social party game has players passing a controller and trying guessing if their friends would date a centaur that has a butt worthy of sleeping on, or if they'd deny a billionaire just because they happen to chew with their mouth open. Earn points for correctly guessing the strange desires and preferences of the other players. Prove that you're the best matchmaker to win the game!

201072.Name: Block Dude
201072.Overview: This is a port of the TI-83 (and other calcs) puzzle game Block Dude. In the game, you control Block Dude, whose powers are to pick up and put down one block at a time. He can also climb one block at a time! Using the blocks, you make your way to the door which brings you to the next level. The original was created by Brandon Sterner and can be found here. There are also great emulators if you don't have the calculator yourself. OR if you have a way to play NES roms, you can play this port :)

201073.Name: Bob's Burgers
201073.Overview: A hack of BurgerTime with Bob from Bob's Burgers.

201074.Name: Bovinium Quest
201074.Overview: The first ever NES “Game Badge” was given to VIGs to be worn as an event badge, and be a playable arcade style NES game! Can you save the cows from alien invaders?

201075.Name: Brain Fu Programming Language Interpreter
201075.Overview: This NES game is an interpreter for the brainfu* programming language, a esoteric Turing Complete programming language that uses only 8 instructions. The standard NES controller is used to create and run programs using only the power of the NES hardware CPU.

201076.Name: DC26-6502
201076.Overview: This NES game is an interpreter for the brainf--k programming language, a programming language that uses only 8 symbols. The standard NES controller is used to create and run programs using only the power of the NES hardware CPU.

201077.Name: Caesar Captain
201077.Overview: A graphical hack of James Bond Jr. released on various bootleg multicarts.

201083.Name: Deja Vu -Uncensored-
201083.Overview: This hack restores all the content that was censored in the US version to make it look more similar to it’s Japanese counterpart.

201084.Name: Captain America: The Winter Soldier
201084.Overview: Captain America makes his way back to the NES in this high Velocity hack! The story loosely follows the movie as you infiltrate the S.H.I.E.L.D. headquarters as a fugitive to find out who is behind S.H.I.E.L.D. being compromised. As he carries out his mission, Captain America must also battle the mysterious Winter Soldier, with whom the Captain feels a strange connection to a huge thanks goes out to B.B. Link, who requested I make this hack!

201085.Name: Carpet Shark
201085.Overview:
Carpet Shark. Released 1/25/2021 For the Nintendo Entertainment System. Based on the 2013 Fista Productions short film.

"A shark's soul is trapped inside an 8x10 area rug. It's General Major Cadaver Scab's duty to keep the shark tame. Can he? CAN ANYONE?"

Play as the Carpet Shark. Eat as many victims as you can before the timer and your health run out. After each level, fight one of the 4 bosses (our characters from the movie). Try to eat the bosses weapons to fire back at them. Can you beat all 4 levels?

201086.Name: Cheril in the Cave
201086.Overview: “Great reward for capturing the evil monster in the cave”, Cheril read in a notice placed in her local bulletin board. “Watermelon candy for life!”. So she put on her pink catsuit and rode her pink motorcycle at full speed to deal with such evil. And to get some candy.

201087.Name: Cheril of the Bosque
201087.Overview:
In the Badajoz jungle lives Cheril, a common girl, just like every other girl of her age. She eats cucumbers, hunts panthers with her bare teeth, flys around using hanging vines and dresses with suggestive animal furs. Nothing out of the blue. But Cheril, niece in second degree of Tartan, the scottish of the apes, has higher expectations. She’s fed up with Eleuterio, the ever serious monkey, which condemns her explosions of crazy and espontaneous youthness, with the lewd stares from Mondongo the aborigin and his cousin Mojinganga, and with those damned snakes which ambush her from behind every bush in the jungle. She want’s something better. She’s decided to go to the city and become part of the “beautiful people”, just like her ancestor Tarzán of the Apes, which went to London and wore a nice Tuxedo.

In fact, Cheril may leave whenever she’s arsed to go, but the journey is long: thirteen days on foot, so she needs to provide herself with enough food. She estimates that a giant nut a day will suffice, so that means that she needs to collect thirteen giant nuts before leaving. Go for it!

201088.Name: Chumlee's Adventure: The Quest for Pinky
201088.Overview:
The hustle and bustle at the World Famous Gold & Silver Pawn Shop has been part of the fabric of Las Vegas for the past thirty years. No one knows this better than Chumlee. 

Chumlee has been an employee at the pawn shop for over 15 years and has seen it all, from priceless artifacts to worthless knock off items. He’s put in thousands of hours of hard work and now he’s finally ready for a break!

Join everyone’s favorite pawn broker Chumlee as he navigates his way through the ever busy pawn shop to enjoy a day in the sun with his pup Pinky! Make your way past the countless customers and their unique items. Battle it out with Antwaun, Corey & Rick before a final encounter that will blow your mind! 

Are you ready for the challenge? Are you ready to “Be Awesome”? Get out there or get back to “Work”!

201090.Name: Conway's Game of Life
201090.Overview:
This is an 40x40 grid implementation of Conway's Game of Life written from scratch in 6502 Assembly to run on the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES).

Because of the 40x40 grid size in this implementation along with likely nonoptimal code, it takes about 1.25 to 1.5 seconds to calculate the next board state. I would like to apologize for how slow this program is and may look into improving the computation speed in the future.

201091.Name: Closing In: Barney's Daring Escape
201091.Overview:
You are Barney, a dog in a world that is running out of space. An unknown power is swallowing the world whole, and to survive you have to move!

Rumor has it there are scientists that can reverse the damage with Vacuum Stabilizer parts. But, the world is collapsing beneath your feet, so you must travel quickly while collecting them.

Can you make it out alive?

201092.Name: Coin Quest: Starring Mario & Luigi
201092.Overview: Mario’s coin collection has been stolen by Bowser! With the help of his brother Luigi, Mario must face the challenges of Bowser’s castle once again to reclaim his cherished coin collection.

201093.Name: The Cowlitz Gamers' Lost Adventure
201093.Overview:
A mini-sequel to The Cowlitz Gamers' 2nd Adventure. It consists of only 18 stages but a new playable character.  The 18 stages were inspired by the unreleased predecessor to the original Cowlitz Gamers' Adventure programmed for the ZX Spectrum.

The 2019 version of this game was included in the Action 53 Vol. 4: Actually 54 multi-cart.  The stand-alone 2020 version is slightly different graphically.

201094.Name: Crystal Castles
201094.Overview: Extracted from the 2004 Atari Flashback console that was built on an "NES-on-a-Chip" architecture.

201095.Name: CypherCon 4.0 Schedule
201095.Overview: An unofficial interactive schedule of the 2019 CypherCon held on April 11-12.

201096.Name: Demo Pills 4 Your Brain
201096.Overview: Demo Pills 4 Your Brain for NES by Digital Sounds System is an Invitro released at Revision 2015. It’s the invitation demo to Nordlicht 2015, which was to happen in Bremen/Germany.

201097.Name: Doctor Who
201097.Overview: A hack of Cosmo Police Galivan for the Famicom.  Join the Doctor as he has his first big adventure for the NES!!! The Doctor must save a mysterious planet from the grips all sorts of creatures!!!

201098.Name: Donkey Trump Jr.
201098.Overview: A rom hack of Donkey Kong Jr. with Donald Trump and Bernie Sanders as Donkey Kong and Mario.

201099.Name: Donkey Trump 3
201099.Overview: A rom hack of Donkey Kong 3 with Donald Trump as Donkey Kong.

201101.Name: Dragon Leap
201101.Overview: After a nice dinner of succulent cattle and one very angry farmer, the little green dragon decided to take a walk while his food settled. So the dragon decided to take a walk though the red mountains. Then the rock crumbled beneath the dragon’s feet as it fell into a strange cave with faces carved into all the walls. Can the little green dragon find it’s way out of 464 rooms spread across 8 strange mazes?

201103.Name: DENDYcompo II
201103.Overview:
DENDYcompo II is a music disk for NES created by Rubel for the 8bit Netlabel 8081.

01. Nuclear Mushroom Boom – Summertime
02. Xenon Odyssey – Convoluted Culvert
03. bertfm – Dancing to Death
04. Harumi Makoto – Wonder Panorama
05. Please Lose Battle – Restrain from entering my bedroom

201104.Name: An Hei Po Huai Shen
201104.Overview:
An Hei Po Huai Shen, also known as Diablo or Diablo II, is a backport of Diablo to the NES by Shenzhen Nanjing. The game is a turn based RPG unlike the real Diablo. The game's music has been taken from games such as Golden Sun.

Like almost all of Shenzhen Nanjing's games, dying in a battle will result in you going back to the title screen.

201139.Name: Esikmo Bob: Starring Alfonzo
201139.Overview:
Eskimo Bob is an 8-bit arcade-style puzzle-platformer. Originally developed for the NES, Eskimo Bob is now available as a NES ROM! One day, Bob and Alfonzo notice that the seal has gone missing. Concerned by this, our heroes set out to find their friend. Only you can help Bob and Alfonzo navigate their way through sixty-four puzzling levels of action, collecting fish and battling bosses along the way!

The Deluxe version adds Two Player Tag Team mode and additional background animations.

201146.Name: Family Picross!
201146.Overview:
Picross is a picture crossword puzzle where you follow the clues to reveal a hidden picture. The board size ranges from a 5x5 block grid up to a 20x15 block grid, and all board sizes can range from easy to challenging.

To play, you use the numbers to fill in the blocks on the grid. Each number represents how many blocks are in a group. For example, 22 would be 2 sets of 2 blocks. In a 5x5 board, the middle block would be left untouched while the 2 blocks on the left and right would be filled in.

201160.Name: D'veel'ng
201160.Overview:
This game was part of the planned, never finished, never released "Cheril" game containing ports of every Cheril game released for the ZX Spectrum as separate levels.

It is just a mirrored version of "Cheril of the Bosque" with a different tileset and different gameplay (featuring shooting).

Some assets and ideas from this game have been (re)used in "MiedoW - Cheri's Nightmares", released for the Nesdev Compo 2017.

Enhancements to MK1 resulted on MK1 v0.4. Improvements include a more efficient storage for enemy placements and tilemaps.

201161.Name: Embered Recollections
201161.Overview: This rom EP consists of music by Heosphoros and was programmed by MorphCat Games.

201170.Name: Exit Loop
201170.Overview:
At it’s heart, Exit Loop is a super simple game. Pick up treasure, avoid obstacles, and get to the exit with as much treasure as possible. The path isn’t long – a successful run can be made in under 5 minutes – but the key is to maximize the amount of treasure you pick up without dying before you find the exit.

EXIT LOOP carries on the fun arcade tradition that we started with BOVINIUM QUEST last year. It reminds us of the challenge of a game like Super Meat Boy or N++, but with multiple screens and paths to get to a goal.

With only one level but so many different paths, options, risks and rewards, Exit Loop is the definition of a game that is easy to learn, but tough to master!

201171.Name: F-FF
201171.Overview:
A basic racing game. Hit select on the menu to get 2p split screen.

D-Pad: Steer
B: Accelerate
A: Boost
Start: Start Game
Select: Enable second player (on menu)

201172.Name: Famicom de Pon
201172.Overview: A simple Panel de Pon clone by Twitter user @teku2hikaru.

201173.Name: Famicompo Pico 1
201173.Overview: A compilation of music for the NES, written by Rainwarrior for the Famicompo Pico 2014 competition.

201174.Name: Famicompo Pico 2
201174.Overview: A compilation of music for the NES, written by Rainwarrior for the Famicompo Pico 2014 competition.
